Modification_Detail.description: Changed inst LIDs from u:n:p:c:i:instID.scID to u:n:p:c:i:scID.instID And per "Guide toPDS4 Context Products" v1.7, changed all lidvid_reference to lid_reference

External_Reference.reference_text: Acuna, M.H., L.F. Burlaga, R.P. Lepping, and N.F. Ness, Initial Results from the Voyager 1 and 2 Magnetic Field Experiments, Proceedings of the Solar Wind IV Conference, Burghausen, 1978, H. Rosenbauer (Ed.), Max Planck Institut, Rept. No. MPAE-W-100-81-31, 1981.
Behannon, K.W., M.H. Acuna, L.F. Burlaga, R.P. Lepping, N.F. Ness, and F.M. Neubauer, Magnetic Field Experiment for Voyagers 1 and 2, Space Sci. Rev., Vol. 21, p. 235, 1977.
Ness, N.F., K.W. Behannon, R.P. Lepping, and K.H. Schatten, Use of Two Magnetometers for Magnetic Field Measurements on a Spacecraft, J. Geophys. Res., Vol. 76, p. 3564, 1971.
Ness, N.F., M.H. Acuna, R.P. Lepping, L.F. Burlaga, K.W. Behannon, and F.M. Neubauer, Magnetic Field Studies at Jupiter by Voyager 2: Preliminary Results, Science, Vol. 206, p. 966, 1979.

Instrument.name: Triaxial Fluxgate Magnetometer
Instrument.description: This experiment was designed to investigate (1) the magnetic fields of Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune and (2) the solar-wind interaction of the magnetospheres of these planets with the interplanetary magnetic field out to the solar-wind boundary with the interstellar magnetic field, and beyond, if crossed. The investigation was carried out using two high-field and two low-field triaxial fluxgate magnetometers. Data accuracy of the interplanetary fields was plus or minus 0.1 nT, and the range of measurements was from 0.01 nT to 2.E-3 T.
